alert.note: Alert for Kit Carson County; Yuma County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued March 09 at 2:13AM MST until March 10 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Goodland
info.description: .Snow will begin to develop in southwest Nebraska Wednesday afternoon and gradually move south. Worst conditions are expected Wednesday night when snow and blowing snow may cause significant travel difficulties, including Interstate 70. Snow will gradually end west to east through the day on Thursday. ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 2 PM MST /3 PM CST/ THIS AFTERNOON TO 5 PM MST /6 PM CST/ THURSDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches. Local amounts of up to a foot possible along the Kansas and Nebrasak border area. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Portions of northwest Kansas, east central and northeast Colorado and southwest Nebraska. * WHEN...From 2 PM MST /3 PM CST/ this afternoon to 5 PM MST /6 PM CST/ Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
